@AsifAkheir
Probably because you watch it on super wide screen so you don't see the black bars..
These subs are scaled for 16/9 (1920/1080) monitors to show on lower black bar.
If you got the VobSub_2.23 I suggest to uninstall it, I have a feeling that's the cause.
If you can't re-scale it in player use the default style for subtitles. Or in Subtitle edit 3.2.8 File/Import subtitle from matroska/save as srt. 
Next time give more info what player you use etc.
Use MPC (klite + ac3 filter + CoreAVC Professional & CUDA + surcode external filter for dts...). It's a pain in the arse to make a perfect configuration but it's worth it. I play everything via hdmi (10 M long cable) to Hi-Fi receiver.
Thanks for the feedback.
